content:
Yes, the growth of the tourism industry in Timmins has been significant. The city's natural resources and scenery, including its lakes, forests, and parks like the Kamiskotia Snow Resort, create opportunities for outdoor recreation and tourism.

Visitors can enjoy activities such as fishing, camping, hiking, skiing, snowmobiling, and hunting. Timmins is also home to the Shania Twain Centre, which attracts tourists interested in music and entertainment.

According to a 2019 report by Tourism Timmins, the tourism industry had an economic impact of about $93 million on the city, and over 135,000 tourists visited the city in 2018. The report also showed that the tourism industry in Timmins supported around 900 jobs.

The City of Timmins and local stakeholders have invested in promoting tourism, and efforts have included developing marketing campaigns, upgrading infrastructure, and supporting events and festivals that attract visitors.

Overall, the growth of the tourism industry in Timmins has been significant and has become an essential driver of the local economy.
